passages.kjv_text: The people that walked in darkness have seen a great light: they that dwell in the land of the shadow of death, upon them hath the light shined.
passages.web_text: The people who walked in darkness have seen a great light. Those who lived in the land of the shadow of death, on them the light has shined.

passages.kjv_text: Then spake Jesus again unto them, saying, I am the light of the world: he that followeth me shall not walk in darkness, but shall have the light of life.
passages.web_text: Again, therefore, Jesus spoke to them, saying, “I am the light of the world. He who follows me will not walk in the darkness, but will have the light of life.”

notes.context: Isaiah prophesies a great light dawning for those living in deep darkness, a promise of hope and liberation. Jesus makes the radical declaration, 'I am the light of the world,' positioning himself as the fulfillment of this ancient prophecy and the ultimate source of spiritual illumination.
notes.reflection: Light exposes, guides, and gives life. How can we not only walk in the light, but also reflect it into the dark corners of the world around us?
